content:
🌍 MARKET NEWS RECAP

Global markets ended the day with mixed results, characterized by a US pullback contrasting with modest gains in Asia and neutral European trade. The $S&P 500 fell 0.35% and the $Nasdaq Composite declined 0.50% as investors engaged in profit-taking, particularly in high-flying technology stocks. European equities showed resilience in the face of US weakness, with the pan-European $Euro Stoxx 600 closing relatively unchanged after trading near its intraday record high. Asia was slightly positive, with the $Shanghai Composite posting a modest gain of 0.16% as investors awaited the release of the Federal Reserve's December meeting minutes.

💼 PORTFOLIO FOCUS

The AI-driven megacap sector experienced a wave of profit-taking, with $NVDA falling over 1.21%, alongside $AMZN, $GOOG, $MSFT, and $TSM, which all saw mild declines, signaling a slight consolidation after a strong annual run. The nuclear energy thesis remains robust as Uranium spot prices rebounded 0.68% to $81.

🌍 MARKET NEWS RECAP

Global equities closed the year-end on a mixed note amid thin holiday volumes and profit-taking in the US. The $S&P 500 and $Nasdaq Composite both slipped around 0.3% and 0.5% respectively, primarily driven by declines in major technology names. European markets, led by the $Euro Stoxx 600, showed resilience, closing marginally higher or relatively unchanged as banking stocks saw modest gains. Asia was mixed, with China's $Shanghai Composite holding steady while Hong Kong's $Hang Seng index climbed 0.9% on regional strength.

💼 PORTFOLIO FOCUS

The AI/Tech sector is consolidating, with $NVDA and $MSFT under pressure from profit-taking, while major news saw $GOOG agree to purchase Intersect Power for $4.75 billion to secure energy capacity for its expanding cloud and AI infrastructure. 🌍 MARKET NEWS RECAP

Global markets traded sideways in extremely thin, year-end volume as investors awaited the release of the Federal Reserve’s December meeting minutes later today. US $S&P 500 and $Nasdaq futures were flat, consolidating following a modest Monday pullback driven by profit-taking in megacap technology. Asia was mixed but saw strength in Hong Kong, with the Hang Seng climbing up to 1.0%, while the Chinese onshore Yuan strengthened past the key 7-per-dollar level for the first time in two years. European equities, including the $Euro Stoxx 50, were virtually unchanged, though the most notable move was a sharp rebound in precious metals, with Silver gaining over 5% after a steep Monday decline.

💼 PORTFOLIO FOCUS

The AI and Technology sector saw continued consolidation, with heavyweights like $MSFT, $AMZN, $GOOG, and $AVGO trading lower alongside $NVDA, which slipped over 1.2% on profit-taking. In the Healthcare sector, $LLY outperformed, rising 0.8% after data suggeste

🌍 MARKET NEWS RECAP

European markets provided a strong counter-narrative to the US pullback, with the $DAX Index advancing 0.57% and the $Euro Stoxx 50 gaining 0.77% in a robust year-end close. US markets saw a continuation of marginal profit-taking in the final session, with the $S&P 500 easing 0.14% and the $Nasdaq Composite slipping 0.24%. Asian indices opened mixed, with the Shanghai Composite seeing minimal movement while the Hang Seng Index retreated over 1% on the last day of trading.

💼 PORTFOLIO FOCUS

The megacap technology sector saw continued year-end profit-taking, impacting major holdings like $NVDA, $MSFT, and $AMZN, as investors locked in gains from the AI-driven rally that fueled the $Nasdaq slip. Healthcare names $LLY and $NOVO-B.CO are consolidating after their strong run, with market attention shifting to 2026 pipeline developments and regulatory clarity. 🌍 MARKET NEWS RECAP

Global markets traded with a modest year-end pullback amid extremely thin holiday volumes, with US $S&P 500 and $Nasdaq 100 futures signaling a soft open, down 0.2% and 0.3% respectively. European bourses were similarly muted, as the Stoxx Europe 600 fell 0.1% and France's CAC 40 declined 0.4% in early trading. In Asia, the $Shanghai Composite managed a marginal gain of 0.1%, contrasting with a 0.9% drop in the Hang Seng index, as investors booked profits on the final trading day of the year.

💼 PORTFOLIO FOCUS

The AI and chip sector, which includes $NVDA, $AVGO, $TSM, $MSFT, and $SNPS, saw a major catalyst with news of $NVDA's potential $20 billion acquisition of Groq's AI inferencing technology, positioning it for the next growth phase in AI adoption. In the GLP-1 space, $NOVO-B.CO submitted a New Drug Application (NDA) to the FDA for its once-weekly CagriSema combination for weight management, intensifying competition with $LLY.
